lemma: Take heed to yourselves. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him
context: People often point out the passage in Matt. 7:3. Hypocrisy is indeed bad. However, our Lord also said in Luke 17:3 "Take heed to yourselves. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him; and if he repents, forgive him". We are commanded by our Lord to rebuke each other if necessary and to forgive if the brother or sister repents. But if you find yourself always being the rebuker and not the rebuke-ee, it's time step back and refer to Matt. 7:3 again.
